title: Transforming Business

title: Business+Tech
summary: Technology has a profound impact on business — shaping the way it is conducted, how products and services are developed and offered, and how people interact with organizations. Our faculty, alumni, and centers and institutes are at the forefront of the intersection of business and technology, and are leading change through both research and practice. Business+Tech builds on these efforts, equipping students with a technology foundation they can use to positively impact business and society.

title: A BUSINESS VIEW OF NONDISCRIMINATION
summary: Rob Egan, a local teacher, stepped before the Wichita City Council in July and asked for help.  'I can hide the fact if I want to, though I don't, that I'm gay,' Egan said, before holding up his cane. 'I cannot hide the fact that I have a disability and it has prevented me from getting jobs before. I spent a long time being ashamed of my disability. I will no longer be ashamed and I ask those who govern our city to affirm that by creating this option simply for recourse against discrimination.'

title: Business Editor's Notebook
summary:
Oct. 3—SINCE IT CLOSED more than 60 years ago, the old YMCA building in Portsmouth has sat empty as a vibrant downtown evolved all around it.

Restaurateurs Peter and Michael Labrie have rechristened the four-story building as a music and culinary venue that will soon also be home to a contemporary art museum.

title: Investment inequality is damaging small businesses, British Business Bank says
summary:
The state-owned British Business Bank was set up in Sheffield in 2014. It found that only 1.5 per cent of equity investment went to its own region of Yorkshire and the Humber

A disparity in equity funding opportunities across the regions of the UK is preventing small and medium-sized businesses from flourishing, the state-owned British Business Bank has found.

Businesses in four regions — London, the South East, the North West and the East — accounted for 86 per cent of equity deals since 2011

title: Is The Technology The Key To Success?
summary:
I often hear a very common statement from clients that has always struck me as interesting. The comment is, I have to use a different technology solution then my rivals, or else how can I possibly gain any advantage?
I find that this reveals a basic flaw in the thinking of end user organizations. The key is not the vendor chosen. Rather it is what you do with that solution.
Now don't get me wrong. There are definitely right and wrong solutions based on what a client needs for their environment.

title: Nvidia Is Building the Future of Technology
summary:
Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) invented the graphics processing unit (GPU) in 1999, revolutionizing the video game industry with ultrarealistic visuals. Unlike central processing units (CPUs), GPUs are designed to perform thousands of calculations simultaneously, meaning they excel at compute-intensive tasks involving big data and artificial intelligence.

title: Transforming Business
summary: With each passing year, each new disruption, each global challenge, what it means to be a transformative business leader evolves. In this special series, we spotlight visionaries who are making change around the world and explore the principles and playbooks that guide them.

title: Business+Tech
summary: Technology has a profound impact on business — shaping the way it is conducted, how products and services are developed and offered, and how people interact with organizations. Our faculty, alumni, and centers and institutes are at the forefront of the intersection of business and technology, and are leading change through both research and practice. Business+Tech builds on these efforts, equipping students with a technology foundation they can use to positively impact business and society.

title: A BUSINESS VIEW OF NONDISCRIMINATION
summary: Rob Egan, a local teacher, stepped before the Wichita City Council in July and asked for help.  'I can hide the fact if I want to, though I don't, that I'm gay,' Egan said, before holding up his cane. 'I cannot hide the fact that I have a disability and it has prevented me from getting jobs before. I spent a long time being ashamed of my disability. I will no longer be ashamed and I ask those who govern our city to affirm that by creating this option simply for recourse against discrimination.'

title: Investment inequality is damaging small businesses, British Business Bank says
summary:
The state-owned British Business Bank was set up in Sheffield in 2014. It found that only 1.5 per cent of equity investment went to its own region of Yorkshire and the Humber

A disparity in equity funding opportunities across the regions of the UK is preventing small and medium-sized businesses from flourishing, the state-owned British Business Bank has found.

Businesses in four regions — London, the South East, the North West and the East — accounted for 86 per cent of equity deals since 2011

title: Is The Technology The Key To Success?
summary:
I often hear a very common statement from clients that has always struck me as interesting. The comment is, I have to use a different technology solution then my rivals, or else how can I possibly gain any advantage?
I find that this reveals a basic flaw in the thinking of end user organizations. The key is not the vendor chosen. Rather it is what you do with that solution.
Now don't get me wrong. There are definitely right and wrong solutions based on what a client needs for their environment.
